ovdesc.p: AZ ALL IN ONE PRODUCT PARAMETER AZ.PRODUCT.PARAMETER All in One Account module enables the Banks to define Account based Loan and Deposit products. The loan/ deposit accounts opened under this module, based on a pre defined All in One Products, are different from the Contract based Loans and Deposits, in view of flexibility in operations, like a normal account. The repayment schedules defined under this module are for the purpose of reference with the account balance, for arriving at the arrears or allowing redraw facilities, on the scheduled dates. AZ.PRODUCT.PARAMETER file describes the parameter details of All in One Account Products. By using this file, Banks can define various types of Loan / Deposit Products under All In One Module (AZ Module) like Education Loan, Housing Loan, Car loan etc., with different features unique to each type of Product. The AZ accounts opened under a particular All in One product, inherits the default features of the product like penal rate, Repayment type, Maximum Interest only period, etc. However, at AZ account level also, changes are accepted to override the defaulted values. Certain validations like minimum term, maximum term, allowed category, maximum back date, minimum and maximum amount (in the case of deposit) are done at the AZ account, with respect to the values defined under the corresponding AZ Product.
RESCHED.TYPE

Defines the types of reschedules for all the AZ accounts opened under this product, for the purpose of linking it with the notice of reschedule. For a particular type of reschedule, the reschedule notice will be linked and the reschedule event will happen after the expiry of reschedule notice. The valid types of reschedules are: 1. Rate Change 2. Lump sum Repayment 3. Redraw 4. Term Change 5. Frequency Change Note: At present only Rate Change is supported.
Multi value field associated with Reschedule Notice
REVOLVING.RATIO

Inputs in this field indicate that the product is a REVOLVING type. Input permitted is Numeric, which is applied to the total drawls made by the customer to arrive at the schedule repayment amounts by way of CC schedules. The ratio input in this field is defaulted to AZ main A/c. Input made can be altered at any time. VALIDATIONS Any numeric from 1-100 Allowed only for CREDIT CARD type of products.
ROLL.MAT.WRK.DAY

This field indicates if the rolled over new maturity date should be a working day or not. If the field is Yes, during rollover of loans & deposits, if the new maturity date happens to be on a holiday, then the system shall set the new maturity date to the first working day after the rolled over date. Assume that value date of AZ is 10th Aug 2005 & maturity date is 15th Aug 2005 . Then during rollover, the system shall set Value date as 15th Aug & new maturity date as 20th Aug. If the field is YES & 20th Aug happens to be a holiday & first working day after rollover is 22nd Aug , then new maturity date will be set to 22nd Aug. If the field is NO, then new maturity date will still be 20th Aug only. Allowed values - YES,NO. NO & null are treated the same.
ROLLOVER.ACCTNG

This field specifies if accounting entries over the AZ.ACCOUNT need to be raised during rollover. This could be useful for passbook printing purposes. For example, Let us assume that the deposit is for 5000. If the MATURITY.INSTR is 'AUTOMATIC ROLLOVER' then during rollover the following entries will be generated. A. Nominated account is given, Case 1. Rollover amount - 5000 Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Cr Nominated a/c 5000 Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Dr Nominated a/c 5000 Case 2. Rollover amount - 6000 Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Cr Nominated a/c 5000 Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 6000 Dr Nominated a/c 6000 Case 3. Rollover amount - 4000 Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Cr Nominated a/c 5000 Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 4000 Dr Nominated a/c 4000 B. No nominated account given, Case 1. Rollover amount - 5000 Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Cr Internal a/c 5000 Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Dr Internal a/c 5000 Case 2. Rollover amount - 6000 Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Cr Internal a/c 5000 Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 6000 Dr Internal a/c 6000 Create a TELLER.DEFAULT crediting AZ.ACCOUNT for 1000. Case 3. Rollover amount - 4000 Dr AZ.ACCOUNT 5000 Cr Internal a/c 5000 Cr AZ.ACCOUNT 4000 Dr Internal a/c 4000 Create a TELLER.DEFAULT debiting Internal account for 1000. MATURITY.DR txn code will be used on the debit side and ROLLOVER.CR txn code will be used on the credit side entries to AZ.ACCOUNT. If nominated account is not provided then an internal account will be used. The category of the internal account need to be defined in ACCOUNT.CLASS application for 'AZROLLOVER' id. Allowed only if ACCT.SYNC is set to 'Y'. Allowed only for FIXED type deposits.
ROLLOVER.CR

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used when raising the credit entry during rollover of deposits. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
SINGLE.LIMIT

This field specifies the value that should be set in the SINGLE.LIMIT field in the ACCOUNT that is attached to this APP. Input can be 'Y', 'N' or ''. If input as 'Y' then the acct that is attached to the product parameter should also have the field single limit marked as yes. If input as 'N' or '' then the acct that is attached to the product parameter cannot have the field single limit marked as 'Y'. In this case all the AZ.ACCOUNT that are linked to the same limit must have REDUCE.LIMIT set to be the same. VALIDATIONS Input can be either 'Y', 'N' or ''.
TAX.ON.CHG.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to identify the entries that are raised due to the tax on charge collected as late payment fee. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y". Debit transction code defined in the TAX file.
TAX.ON.INT.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the loan/deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to signify that the entry is a tax on interest entry when the TAX.KEY is defined in AZ.ACCOUNT. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y". Both debit / credit transaction code allowed. Debit/Credit transaction code should be the same as the transaction code defined in TAX table. For instance, if TAX.KEY is defined as 10 in AZ.ACCOUNT, in the respective Tax table, the Credit/debit transaction code is defined as 243/244, then the same codes should be defined here.
TERM.PRIORITY

Specifies whether the Term of the loan has to be prioritised and kept constant or not, in the case of Re scheduling. In AZ Loan accounts, the term of the loan or repayment amount may change due to certain factors like Principal increase, Principal decrease, change in Rate of interest, change in frequency etc. In such cases, it is possible to retain the original term and the maturity date as constant and change the repayment amount suitably, by specifying the Term Priority as 'Y'. If Term Priority is specified as 'N', then by keeping the repayment amount as constant the term will be changed by altering the maturity date of the loan. This field has to be opted by the user whenever a Rescheduling of the loan account is to be done. According to the value defined here, Rescheduling will be done and the previous schedule will be written to AZ.SCHEDULES.HIST. In case of annuity type of loans if the user defined annuity amount is greater than the system generated amount then the contract will be matured earlier than the actual maturity date even though this field is set to 'Y'. In case of OTHERS/NONRED type of loans, TERM.PRIORITY 'N' is not applicable as they may have uneven payments. Hence if AZ contract is of OTHERS/NONRED type of loans, then system shall ignore the value in this field and work as if TERM.PRIORITY is 'Y'.
Valid value 'Y' or 'N'
BONUS.PREMIUM

Defines the code relevant for crediting premium amount to the Deposit account. It is more relevant in the case of Deposit accounts like Savings Plan/ Recurring Deposit etc., where for prompt payment of installments a certain amount will be credited to the account as bonus. Bonus is not applicable to multi deposits
Should be a valid code defined in FT.CHARGE.TYPE, FT.COMMISSION.TYPE By prefixing ' * ' with the ID of SAVINGS.PREMIUM, it can be linked to SAVINGS.PREMIUM
CARD.TYPE

Input in this field should be a valid id in CARD.TYPE application. When input the APP id will be populated in the attached CARD.TYPE. VALIDATIONS Any valid card type id can be input. Input allowed only for CREDIT CARD type of loans.
CC.AMT.RTN

This field holds a user defined API which calculates and updates the TYPE.CC amount in a CREDIT-CARD type AZ loan account created under this product. If exists, this API will be executed to calculate and update TYPE.CC amount field in AZ.SCHEDULES for both AZ sub account and AZ main account.
: A valid key from EB.API file Input allowed only with repayment type as CREDIT-CARD
CC.PR.GRACE.PERIOD

For any repayment type if the GENERATION of CC schedules (principal repayment schedule) is to be postponed then this field is used. Input permitted in this field is Numeric and it should be read along with the frequency input in the repay date field of card issue application. When a card issue frequency is monthly and input made in this field is 3, it means for 3 months the generation of CC schedule is to be postponed, i.e., NO CC schedule is generated. If in card issue the frequency is weekly then it is to be interpreted that 'CC' schedules will not be generated for 3 weeks. For a Non Redemption type, input in this field is mandatory. This is for the reason that in Non Redemption type CI (interest) schedules are generated regularly and the Principal (CC schedules) repayment is made in one BULLET payment. VALIDATIONS Input allowed only if the Repayment Type is a Non redemption Allowed only for CREDIT CARD type of products.
CHARGE.DR.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to identify the entries that are raised while charging the late payment fee. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
COMPOUND.TYPE
This field accepts the frequency like DAILY,WEEKn, MONTHnn, Nnn to determine the compounding period in a year.
: ALLOWED for fixed deposits only
CR.DEP.FQU

Defines the frequency of further credits to the deposit account. In the case of deposits like Savings Plan, Recurring Deposit, this field is use for defining the frequency of future credits expected. For example, if M01 is defined here, regular monthly credits to the account are expected.

Type of input allowed are: D<nn>,W<nn>, M<nn>. This field and grace period field should have a rationale input i.e. Grace can't be Month. End while the deposit frequency is daily. This validation is valid from 14.2.00 with the introduction of period. end option in Grace period field.
CR.INT.FQU

Defines the frequency for interest credit, for all deposit accounts opened under this product. Example If 'M01' is defined here, this frequency will be defaulted to the deposit account of this product and interest will be credited / capitalised every month from the start date. This is acheived by defaulting the 'I' schedule into the az.account during creation. If a liquidation account is defined in ACCOUNT then interest will be credited to that account as per this frequency. Otherwise the interest will be capitalised in the Deposit account itself If 'NM01' is defined here, then the interest will be paid out to the nominated account after capitalising it every month from the start date. This is acheived by defaulting the 'IN' schedule into the az.account during creation. This field is also used during deposit rollover. Based on the setup done here either a 'I' or 'IN' schedule will be created during rollover. If this is not defined then the 'IN' schedule will be created on maturity after rollover.
Type of input allowed are: Dnn,Wnn, Mnn
CR.INT.TYPE

Defines the type by which the credit interest frequency will be processed for the deposit accounts opened under this product. This field is associated with CR.INT.FQU ( frequency for interest credit) Allowed types are: ANNIVERSARY / PERIOD.END If ANNIVERSARY is defined then the credit interest frequency will be based on the opening date. If PERIOD.END is defined then the credit interest will be based on the calendar end like month end.
CR.TXN.CODE

Defines the Transaction Code to be used on the Credit entry generated by AZ. The Transaction Code of the entry is used to determine the references and narratives to be printed on statements. The Debit/Credit indicators within the Transaction Code table are not used to verify this input. If the ACCT.SYNC field is "Y" -then the transaction code defined here might be used as a default for the other leg of the transaction that it not affecting the loan. The transaction code defined here should be used or duplicated in any other field. See example in DR.TXN.CODE.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be an existing code in Transaction Table.
ACCT.SYNC

Allowed values are 'YES' and ''. If 'YES' then the working balance in a/c and the principal in AZ.ACCOUNT created will be in sync. This can be achieved by using specific transaction codes for specific AZ related events. (For more details on transaction codes and events, refer the help text for various fields like DRAWDOWN.TXN). If the input is 'NULL', the two balances might not be in harmony. If 'YES', then an entry over the AZ.ACCOUNT should contain a valid txn code (apart from DR.TXN.CODE and CR.TXN.CODE) defined in its APP so that it knows how to process the entry within AZ. VALIDATIONS Permitted values either 'YES' or ''. Once input the values cannot be changed.
CREATE.PD.EOD

For CREDIT CARD type of products this field indicates if PD has to be created during COB on the schedule dates if the repay account has insufficient funds. If set as 'YES' then PD will be created during COB, else PD will have to created through a online payment beyond the schedule date. This field is valid only for CREDIT CARD type of products. This field is allowed only if PD.LINK.TO.AZ.is set to 'YES'. Allowed values are 'YES', 'NO', ''. 'NO' and '' are considered to be the same. For credit cards, system has to settles first by date wise and then by component wise. Hence related PD.PARAMETER should have REPAYMENT.METHOD as '3' and only the following components are settled by AZ and in the order REPAYMENT.ORDER as A1,TX,A2,PE,PS,IN,PR
CREATE.TD.FOR.INT

This field indicates whether to create TELLER.DEFAULT or not for the interest amount during part withdrawal(through TELLER) /Pre closure when till account is used as credit side account. . If this value is YES then a TELLER.DEFAULT record will be created when a TELLER transaction is processed debiting an AZ.ACCOUNT Fixed Deposit. This will only be created when no nominated/interest liquidation is specified on the AZ.ACCOUNT. If the field CREATE.TD.FOR.INT is NULL the interest will be credited to the credit side account irrespective of it being the till account.
: Value of YES is permitted only for Deposits & with Teller product installed in the company
CREDIT.AMT.MULTI

This field indicates if B schedules need to be validated to be in multiples of the CREDIT.AMOUNT defined in AZ.ACCOUNT. If 'YES' is set then the B schedule amount can be only in multiples of the the CREDIT.AMOUNT, if defined in AZ.ACCOUNT. Allowed values are 'YES' or ''. Allowed only for SAVINGS PLAN type of deposit products. Allowed only if ACCT.SYNC is set as 'YES'.
DEP.DR.MATURITY

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to when raising the debit entry during normal deposit maturity. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
DEP.DR.PART

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to signify that the entry is a part withdrawal of a deposit. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
DEP.DR.PRE.CLOSURE

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to signify that the entry is due to preclosure of a deposit. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
DEPOSIT.CR

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to signify that the entry is a deposit credit entry. If MULTI is set as 'Y' then a sub account is created else a principle increase is made. In case of clearing credits the transction code for collection, the txn code defined in CQ.PARAMETER / ACCOUNT.PARAMETER that is used when the cheque is marked as CLEARED, has to be defined here. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
DESCRIPTION
Identifies the name of the Product in a more descriptive form ( example : Home Loan, Education Loan)
1-35 type alpha characters Mandatory Input Multi valued for languages
DR.TXN.CODE

Defines the Transaction Code to be used on the Debit entry generated by AZ. The Transaction Code of the entry is used to determine the references and narratives to be printed on statements. The Debit/Credit indicators within the Transaction Code table are not used to verify this input. The transaction code defined here should be used or duplicated in any other field. If the ACCT.SYNC field is "Y" -then the transaction code defined here might be used as a default for the other leg of the transaction that it not affecting the loan / deposit when the transaction is triggered from AZ.ACCOUNT. To exemplify, In Credit Card type of loan, if the loan repayment takes place. Dr. will be to the internal/customer/nominated a/c and credit to the loan a/c. As debit side of the transaction is not affecting the loan (debit to a customer a/c)- the transaction code will be one inscribed in this field.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Must be an existing code in Transaction Table.
DRAWDOWN.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the loan side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. Draw down Txn implies making a draw down on the loan a/c- where Debit will be to the Loan a/c and Credit will be to the Nominated a/c. When entered the system automatically identifies the transaction code as an EVENT of Draw down. Whenever, loan is drawn this TXN code is used to identify the event, if ACCT.SYNC.is set to 'Y'. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid id in transaction application. TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e loan repay, Draw down etc Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y".
ALLOWED.CATEG

The default category to which the All in One product is allocated. It is ensured by the system that all AZ accounts opened under this product, belong to the category entered here. The category code is used to classify financial transactions in T24 according to the type of business operations or product type. The first two digits represents the highest level classification and next three digits represents sub classification which provides a clear definition of the profit and loss or the product type. The use of these codes with personal customer characteristics (like Residence, Status, Sector code etc.,) will enable the Banks to produce balance sheets and returns reflecting a coordinated and structured view of its operation, by directing business transactions to their appropriate place in the report.

5-7 Numeric Codes It must be an existing code in the CATEGORY table For customer Accounts, it must be in the range of 1000 to 9999 The category is defaulted to AZ.ACCOUNT from the corresponding ACCOUNT record and validated against the category code defined here.
DRAWDOWN.TYPE

Defines a type of drawdown for this product, which specifies the method of withdrawing the Principal amount, from the loan accounts of this product. The various types of drawdowns are: 1. Full Drawdown: The entire loan amount has to be withdrawn at a time. No partial withdrawals are allowed 2. Partial and No interest: Partial or full withdrawal of the loan amount is permitted from the loan account. Interest and Principal repayment need not be done during the drawdown period. 3. Partial and interest: The drawdown of loan amount can be done in partial or in full. During the drawdown period repayment towards interest has to be made. Otherwise it will be treated as arrears. If a nominated account is defined, in all the options, the system will automatically transfer the drawdown amount on the drawdown date to the nominated account. If no nominated account is defined and if the drawdown is preferred through the AZ account itself, then a teller default will be created and the amount can be drawn through teller using the teller default feature.
Valid for Loan products only. Valid numbers are 1,2,3. Default is 1 (Full Drawdown) Must be 1 for CREDIT CARD type of loans.
EARLY.RED.MARGIN

Defines the margin rate of interest that has to be deducted from the eligible rate arrived for early redemption of deposit amount. For example if margin is defined as 2, and for early redemption of a deposit the eligible interest was arrived as 9% after referring the interest table, then the final interest paid for this early redemption will be 7%
Numeric Value.
EXTEND.MAT.DATE
Currently noinput field. For future use.
FORWARD.ACC.MNTHS
For future use.
GRACE.PERIOD

Defines the period in number of days, until the expiry of which the loan accounts under this product, shall not be considered to be in arrears. If the account continues to be in arrears status, even after the expiry of the grace period, penalty interest will be applied on the arrears, as per penalty parameters defined.
Optional field 1-999 numeric Cannot have negative values.
HIGHEST.RANGE

This field should be read along with the field AMT.PERCENT. Input in this field indicates the product is RANGED Revolving type. It is a multi value set. The field Highest Range can take only amount which implies the range. Each drawals is taken and is matched with the range within which it falls. The %age or the amount specified in the range under amt. percent field is applied to arrive at the CC amount. REVOLVING.RATIO *10% HIGHEST.RANGE 100000 AMT.PERCENT B*100 HIGHEST.RANGE 300000 AMT.PERCENT *10 HIGHEST.RANGE 500000 AMT.PERCENT 250000 (1) A '*', before the numeric entered in AMT.PERCENT is must or else the system will deem it as amount and will generate CC schedule for only USD10 and not 10% of the outstanding. (2) A 'B*100', implies '100% of the balance in the acct'. This is because when the outstanding in a sub acct falls within this range then it is obvious that as per the minimum class an amount of 100000 is payable. However, if the outstanding in the acct is 98573 in that case CC schedule amount will be more than the outstanding that is actually payable if we stick to the concept of 100000 minimum. To obviate this we have introduced the concept 100% of the balance outstanding or 100000. (3) The fields Highest Range and Amt. Percent can be multi valued to specify different ranges. Amt. Percent field can be input either with a %age or an amount. A sub acct indicating a draw down is taken and is matched for a range within which it falls and the %age specified in the amt. percent field for that range is applied. If the AMT.PERCENT field contains an amount the system doesn't calculate any %age, but takes the amount as the 'CC' amount. For ex: (1) Reference to the table, if the amount of draw down in a sub a/c comes to 250000 then it falls within the range of 300000 hence attracts 10% of the range as the 'CC' amount. (2) Similarly, if the draw down in a sub a/c comes to 500000 then it attracts a flat amount of 250000 instead of any % age since the AMT.PERCENT field contains an amount. (3) If the draw down in a sub a/c comes to 600000, since there is no range within which it falls it automatically attracts the revolving %age for generation of 'CC' schedule amount, which in the present case (refer table) will be 10%. VALIDATIONS Input allowed only if the Repayment Type is Ranged Revolving. Allowed only for CREDIT CARD type of products.
INT.ADJ.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the loan/deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to signify that the entry is a interest adjustment entry.This is applicable only for Annuity contracts and if this entry is encountered, then the system shall debit AZINTADJ Suspense account instead of the underlying AZ Account. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y". Only debit transaction code allowed. Value date in the entry should be same as the bank date(TODAY). Applicable only for ANNUITY contracts with Reduce limit as 'NO'.
INT.BASIS

Defines the method of determining the number of days used for debit interest calculations. In each of the options specified below the number on the left represents the number of days basis for multiplying Can accept the following types: Key G is used as interest basis for the weekly frequency defined in loan account schedule. For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS INTEREST.BASIS

Optional input. If no value is defined for this field in AZ.PRODUCT.PARAMETER, then for all the AZ.ACCOUNTs relating to this product, the interest basis will be picked up by the system automatically based on the currency of the account, by referring the CURRENCY table. characters of value A, B, C, D, E, F, or G
INT.CORR.IMMED

Defines the way system should collect interest correction amount . Value NEXT is allowed only for Annuity contracts & with ANNUITY.ADJUST as YES . When correction entries are raised due to back-dated drawdown or repayment, then the system collects the correction amount from AZINTADJ Suspense account immediately . Only during NEXT repayment( online/cob), the system shall collect above correction amount from repayment account. Default value is CURRENT and in this case, correction amount is collected immediately from the repayment account . Values - CURRENT,NEXT
INT.CORR.RTN

A local hook routine triggered when interest correction entry is raised for Annuity contracts with Annuity adjustment as YES. It takes precedence over INT.CORR.IMMED. It should be called with the following arguments (ACC.ID,'',INT.CORR.IMMED) where ACC.ID is input argument & holds the AZ Account ID currently being processed. Y.INT.CORR.IMMED is output returned from this subroutine & should hold the values of CURRENT, NEXT only.
AMT.PERCENT
Refer help text of HIGHEST.RANGE field.
INT.CORR.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the loan/deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. This txn code is used to signify that the entry is a interest correction entry. Interest correction can be for various reason like preclosure or part withdrawal in deposits etc... VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e. loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to "Y". Both debit / credit transaction code allowed. Refer to INT.CR.CAP for transaction codes that need to be setup.
INT.CR.CAP

This pertains to AZ deposits where on Capitalisation date interest is capitalized to the credit of the deposit acct using this TXN code. Valid Transaction code should be entered. This txn code is used capitalization of interest to the deposit acct, where Credit will be to the deposit acct and debit to the interest payable category. When TXN code is entered the system will automatically identify the transaction code as event of Interest Credit Cap. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid 'ID' in Transaction application TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT Mandatory input if the ACCT. SYNC is set to 'Y' Refer to INT.DR.CAP on the specific transaction codes that need to defined..This is not applicable for ANNUITY/ CREDIT CARDS.
INT.DR.CAP

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the loan / deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. Interest Dr. Cap implies the Capitalization of interest to the loan a/c- where Debit will be to the loan a/c and Credit to the Interest Receivable category. When entered the system automatically identifies the transaction code as an EVENT of Interest Dr. Cap. When the interest is capitalized, this CODE is used on the Debit side of the Transaction for identifying the event. In case of a loan during I schedule the system would raise an entry to debit the az.account with 392/391 as the txn code. During N schedule the system would raise an entry to credit the az account with the value defined in the first multi value of INT.CR.CAP. In case of a deposit during I schedule the system would raise an entry to credit the az.account with 382/381 as the txn code. During N schedule the system would raise an entry to debit the az account with the value defined in the first multi value of INT.DR.CAP. When interest is to be paid manually then these fields could be multivalued and different txn codes can be defined if needed. VALIDATIONS Must be a valid "ID" in Transaction application. TXN codes are input to identify the EVENT i.e loan repay, Draw down etc. Mandatory input if the ACCOUNT. SYNC is set to 'Y' The following table gives the txn codes that have to be defined in addition to any other txn codes. Field Name Interest liq acct Loan Deposit INT.CR.CAP Yes 392 382 No 391 381 INT.DR.CAP Yes 392 382 No 391 381 INT.CORR.TXN Yes 396 386 No 395 385
INT.FIXED.RATE

Indicates the annual fixed interest rate applicable for the loan / deposit accounts opened under this Product. The rate of interest is defaulted to the AZ account from here. However, the interest rate can be modified at the account level also.
1- 5 numeric characters of rate type, like 18.50.
INT.ONLY

This field is used to define whether 'interest only repayment' is allowed for this product or not. If Y (Yes) is defined, accounts opened under this product shall be able to have Interest Only repayment facility If N (No) is defined, accounts of this product shall not be able to have the Interest Only repayment facility. For loan accounts with repayment type 'Non Redemption', no validation will be done with respect to this field.
The permitted values are 'Y' or 'N' Valid only for Loan products Default is 'N'
INT.SUS.TXN

Valid Transaction code should be entered. Txn codes that affect the loan/deposit side (Debit or Credit) are identified and categorized as TXN codes. It is applicable only for Annuity contracts . APPROPRIATE.TYPE

This field decides how a repayment received should be apportioned among the various withdrawals made under a Credit Card account. Permitted inputs are (1) Proportionate and (2) FIFO [First in First Out]. TO ILLUSTRATE: - Suppose there are 3 draws through sub a/c Withdrawal 1 350000 Withdrawal 2 650000 Withdrawal 3 250000 TOTAL 1250000 Appropriation Type- Proportionate If the repayment received, is 125000 the set-off will be 125000*350000/1250000 Towards Drawl (1) -35000 ----I.e.- 125000*350000/1250000 Towards Drawl, (2) it is 65000--I.e.- 125000*650000/1250000 Finally toward drawl (3) 25000--I.e.- 125000*250000/1250000 Appropriation Type- FIFO If on the other hand the repayment received is, say 450000 and type is FIFO then: - First withdrawal of 350000 will be fully adjusted and then remaining amount of 100000 will be adjusted towards the O/s of second withdrawal. This way it will continue until the last drawl is met with fully. VALIDATIONS: Input can be either Proportionate or FIFO. Input is subject to change. Allowed only for CREDIT CARD type of products.

RATE.PERIOD

Input in this field implies that the product is a Fixed Floating type. A Fixed Floating product initially takes a FIXED rate of interest and then moves to floating rate of interest till maturity based on the PERIOD input in the field RATE.PERIOD. Values may be input in the following format, i.e. nnD or nnM or nny The floating rate is prompted by 'R' schedule without which a FIXED FLOATING deposit or loan acct cannot be committed or authorized. The rates of interest both FIXED and FLOATING are defaulted from APP. A combination of the following interest is permitted for input, (1) BASIC.INTEREST (BI) and FIXED.RATE (2) BASIC.INTEREST (BI) and PERIODIC INTEREST (PI) To illustrate, In AZ.PRODUCT.PARAMETER the RATE.PERIOD is input as 03M. The Fixed Floating Deposit Start date is 05.04.2003 and maturity date is 04.04.2004. Interest is FIXED at 20% (field INT.FIXED.RATE) and for floating BI rate with RATE.KEY as 01 RATE.SPREAD as 2% RATE.OPERAND as ADD [Assume that the BI rate on the date of R schedule is 6.75%] System takes FIXED rate of interest at 20% from 05.04.2003 to 05.07.2003 And FLOATING rate at 8.75% (6.75% + 2%) from 06.07.2003 till 04.04.2004 Thus RATE.PERIOD is the field that differentiates a FIXED-FLOATING contract from other types of contracts. Based on the input in this field 'R' schedule is triggered to bring FLOATING rate in to operation. VALIDATIONS (1) Two numeric and One alphanumeric input allowed. (2) Permitted values in RATE.PERIOD nn>D, nn>M and nn>Y (3) Fixed and Floating interest rates are defaulted from APP- user has the option to change the FIXED rate of interest directly at account level and FLOATING rate by changing the INTEREST. RATE value in BI table. (4) The change in Rate. key value can be gauged from the ACI record only (5) Spread cannot be changed it is fixed. (6) For fixed floating a combination of BI + PI, BI + FIXED is allowed but not PI AND FIXED. (7) Not applicable for credit cards

REPAYMENT.TYPE

Defines the Repayment type of the All in One Accounts opened under this product. This type determines the way in which the loan / deposit account is to be repaid. The repayment types available for loan accounts are: 1. ANNUITY This type of loan has a fixed periodic repayment amount (the 'annuity') consisting of two variable components of principal and interest. The repayment amount is calculated at the start of the contract so that the principal will be fully repaid after the required number of repayments. Initially, repayments consist mostly of interest. However, as the contract progresses, the size of the principal component increases as the accrued interest reduces. In All in One loan account, for defining a zero repayment at the start of the loan, for a fixed period, Annuity type of repayment can be defined in the schedule with amount as Zero. 2. LINEAR Linear loans also have an interest and a principal component to their periodic repayments. This field should be read along with the field AMT.PERCENT. Input in this field indicates the product is RANGED Revolving type. It is a multi value set. The field Highest Range can take only amount which implies the range. Each drawals is taken and is matched with the range within which it falls. The %age or the amount specified in the range under amt. percent field is applied to arrive at the CC amount. REVOLVING.RATIO *10% HIGHEST.RANGE 100000 AMT.PERCENT B*100 HIGHEST.RANGE 300000 AMT.PERCENT *10 HIGHEST.RANGE 500000 AMT.PERCENT 250000 (1) A '*', before the numeric entered in AMT.PERCENT is must or else the system will deem it as amount and will generate CC schedule for only USD10 and not 10% of the outstanding. (2) A 'B*100', implies '100% of the balance in the acct'. This is because when the outstanding in a sub acct falls within this range then it is obvious that as per the minimum class an amount of 100000 is payable. However, if the outstanding in the acct is 98573 in that case CC schedule amount will be more than the outstanding that is actually payable if we stick to the concept of 100000 minimum. To obviate this we have introduced the concept 100% of the balance outstanding or 100000. (3) The fields Highest Range and Amt. Percent can be multi valued to specify different ranges. Amt. Percent field can be input either with a %age or an amount. A sub acct indicating a draw down is taken and is matched for a range within which it falls and the %age specified in the amt. percent field for that range is applied. If the AMT.PERCENT field contains an amount the system doesn't calculate any %age, but takes the amount as the 'CC' amount. For ex: (1) Reference to the table, if the amount of draw down in a sub a/c comes to 250000 then it falls within the range of 300000 hence attracts 10% of the range as the 'CC' amount. (2) Similarly, if the draw down in a sub a/c comes to 500000 then it attracts a flat amount of 250000 instead of any % age since the AMT.PERCENT field contains an amount. (3) If the draw down in a sub a/c comes to 600000, since there is no range within which it falls it automatically attracts the revolving %age for generation of 'CC' schedule amount, which in the present case (refer table) will be 10%. Defines the Repayment type of the All in One Accounts opened under this product. This type determines the way in which the loan / deposit account is to be repaid. The repayment types available for loan accounts are: 1. ANNUITY This type of loan has a fixed periodic repayment amount (the 'annuity') consisting of two variable components of principal and interest. The repayment amount is calculated at the start of the contract so that the principal will be fully repaid after the required number of repayments. Initially, repayments consist mostly of interest. However, as the contract progresses, the size of the principal component increases as the accrued interest reduces. In All in One loan account, for defining a zero repayment at the start of the loan, for a fixed period, Annuity type of repayment can be defined in the schedule with amount as Zero. 2. LINEAR Linear loans also have an interest and a principal component to their periodic repayments. In this case, however, the principal repayment amount remains fixed over the lifetime of the contract. The interest element reduces as the accrued interest on the reducing balance decreases. This leads to a repayment scheme whereby the total periodic repayment reduces over the lifetime of the contract. 3. NONRED In NONRED type of loans, there is no regular repayment of principal, but only interest. The redemption of Principal will be done on maturity date of the loan. In All in One account loans, the validations relating to Interest Only and Maximum Period interest only will not happen for this type of loan. 4. OTHER Non structured repayments are handled under this type. Repayment of any amount on any dates are allowed, provided the total repayment amount is equal to principal. 5.CREDIT CARD This type of Loan repayment type was added from G14.0.00. For this repayment type, the schedules are NO. When the repayment type is Credit Card the regular schedules are discarded, sub a/cs are created and new types of schedules like CI, CC are generated automatically. Repayment types available for Deposit accounts are: FIXED Deposit amount is accepted in a fixed lump sum and repaid as fixed amount either with interest accumulated or not. SAVING PLAN Deposit amount is accepted in a periodic basis and the principal is increased in a recurring manner till the end of a fixed term.

Input in this field implies that the product is a Fixed Floating type. A Fixed Floating product initially takes a FIXED rate of interest and then moves to floating rate of interest till maturity based on the PERIOD input in the field RATE.PERIOD. Values may be input in the following format, i.e. nnD or nnM or nny The floating rate is prompted by 'R' schedule without which a FIXED FLOATING deposit or loan acct cannot be committed or authorized. The rates of interest both FIXED and FLOATING are defaulted from APP. A combination of the following interest is permitted for input, (1) BASIC.INTEREST (BI) and FIXED.RATE (2) BASIC.INTEREST (BI) and PERIODIC INTEREST (PI) To illustrate, In AZ.PRODUCT.PARAMETER the RATE.PERIOD is input as 03M. The Fixed Floating Deposit Start date is 05.04.2003 and maturity date is 04.04.2004. Interest is FIXED at 20% (field INT.FIXED.RATE) and for floating BI rate with RATE.KEY as 01 RATE.SPREAD as 2% RATE.OPERAND as ADD [Assume that the BI rate on the date of R schedule is 6.75%] System takes FIXED rate of interest at 20% from 05.04.2003 to 05.07.2003 And FLOATING rate at 8.75% (6.75% + 2%) from 06.07.2003 till 04.04.2004 Thus RATE.PERIOD is the field that differentiates a FIXED-FLOATING contract from other types of contracts. Based on the input in this field 'R' schedule is triggered to bring FLOATING rate in to operation. VALIDATIONS (1) Two numeric and One alphanumeric input allowed. (2) Permitted values in RATE.PERIOD nn>D, nn>M and nn>Y (3) Fixed and Floating interest rates are defaulted from APP- user has the option to change the FIXED rate of interest directly at account level and FLOATING rate by changing the INTEREST. RATE value in BI table. (4) The change in Rate. key value can be gauged from the ACI record only (5) Spread cannot be changed it is fixed. (6) For fixed floating a combination of BI + PI, BI + FIXED is allowed but not PI AND FIXED. (7) Not applicable for credit cards

The default category to which the All in One product is allocated. It is ensured by the system that all AZ accounts opened under this product, belong to the category entered here. The category code is used to classify financial transactions in T24 according to the type of business operations or product type. The first two digits represents the highest level classification and next three digits represents sub classification which provides a clear definition of the profit and loss or the product type. The use of these codes with personal customer characteristics (like Residence, Status, Sector code etc.,) will enable the Banks to produce balance sheets and returns reflecting a coordinated and structured view of its operation, by directing business transactions to their appropriate place in the report.
